pageContext.claim: “The seven-day case average for Germany has increased by 62 percent since last week, unfortunately -- and that is truly unfortunate. It's increased 82 percent in France, 113 percent in Spain, and 30 percent in the United Kingdom. Those are big increases.”
pageContext.analysis: These percentages are suspect because over the summer, European countries had relatively small case loads compared to the United States. Note that Trump refers to a "seven-day case average" which is not apparent in WHO data, which showed a weekly increase in Germany of about 30% and a weekly gain in Spain of about 38%.
